moves.4. d3 d5 5. exd5 Qxd5 6. c4 Qd8 7. Nc3 B: Qd6 instead sets up a nice knight fork.  Does the queen have any escape route here if white plays Rfb1?
moves.19. Rfb1 Nxe4+ 20. dxe4 Rfd8+: Black had to sacrifice a knight to create the escape route, but it looks like this worked.
moves.21... Qc2 22. Bd1: Ra2 I think would have forced that queen rook trade.  Knight covers both rooks, queen protects knight.  That would block Qd2+.
White is going to regret that pawn.  Ph3 opens an escape hatch for the white king.
